Actors: Al Pacino, Chris O&#039;Donnell, James Rebhorn, Gabrielle Anwar, 
Philip Seymour Hoffman 
Directors: Martin Brest 
Format: Dubbed, PAL, Widescreen 
Language English, French 
Aspect Ratio: 1.85:1 
Studio: Universal Pictures UK 
DVD Release Date: 29 Mar 2004 
Run Time: 149 minutes 

Synopsis:
Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, 
Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired 
army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O&#039;Donnell), a poor college 
student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving 
weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, 
where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, 
have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, 
commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of 
the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. 
Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the 
right strings, thanks to O&#039;Donnell&#039;s sympathetic supporting role 
and Pacino&#039;s powerful lead performance, for which he won his first 
Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film 
Profumo Di Donna. ~ Stephen Thomas Erlewine.
